origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: United Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers of America. Research Department

did.abstract: The research department of the United Electrical, Radio, and Machine Workers of America (UE) was developed to gather information regarding companies and labor issues concerning the union. This subgroup contains the files of UE Executive Assistant and National Activities Director Lyle Dowling and UE Research Director Nat Spero, which include press releases, correspondence, and clippings regarding a variety of topics relating to the UE and the American labor movement.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The research department of the United Electrical, Radio, and Machine Workers of America (UE) was developed to gather information regarding companies and labor issues concerning the union. This information is used by UE locals and the national office to develop publications that inform members of any concerns affecting their workplace and reports used to assist in negotiating contracts with employers.

This subgroup is concerned with two members of the research department. Lyle Dowling served as UE Executive Assistant and National Activities Director from 1939-1942. Nathan "Nat" Spero served as the UE's Research Director from 1944 to 1983. Prior to his time with the union, Spero worked on projects for the United States' Department of Labor. In addition to his role in the research department, he was also involved in the UE national conventions and committees, as well as serving as editor of the UE Officer's Report from 1951 to 1982. After his time with the UE, Spero taught math and labor history at Queens College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subgroup contains the files of UE Executive Assistant and National Activities Director Lyle Dowling and UE Research Director Nat Spero. These records include press releases, correspondence, and clippings regarding a variety of topics relating to the UE and the American labor movement.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Subject files within each series are arranged alphabetically.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the United Electrical, Radio, and Machine Workers of America on 1976 and 1986. Additional materials regarding Nathan Spero were donated by Jane LaTour in November 2006.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: UE Research Department Personnel Papers, 1937-2001, UE.10.1, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: UE Research Department Personnel Papers, 1937-2001, UE.10.1, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Meredith Johnson in December 2008. The guide to this collection was written by Meredith Johnson and Zachary Brodt in April 2009

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Congress of Industrial Organizations Collection, 1938-1982, UE.10.2.2, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System
All series in subgroup UE.10.2 are records of the UE Research Department on various topics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subgroup contains some of the records of Lyle Dowling, UE Executive Assistant and National Activities Director from 1939-1942. The materials contained here are mostly Federated Press Releases, clippings from other publications, bulletins and correspondence. Communications from Dowling are typically between districts, the national office, and national UE officers such as James Matles, the Director of Organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subgroup contains various work-related materials of Nat Spero, Research Director for the UE from 1944 to 1983. This collection contains pamphlets and articles on various labor issues that were used as research material for union publications. Also included are letters of correspondence requesting information on a variety of labor related topics and annual reports, as well as work related documents from Spero's time with the Works Progress Administration. Photographs, cards by Fred Wright and research material collected by researcher Jane LaTour are also present.
